cycloneMessage.issuingUnit: NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL
cycloneMessage.systemGeoRefPt1: ABOUT 480 MI...770 KM SSW OF THE SOUTHERN TIP OF BAJA CALIFORNIA
cycloneMessage.message:
ZCZC MIATCPEP4 ALL TTAA00 KNHC DDHHMM
BULLETIN Hurricane Hilary Advisory Number 22 NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL EP092017 300 PM MDT Wed Jul 26 2017
...HILARY CONTINUES MOVING WESTWARD AS A CATEGORY 2 HURRICANE...
SUMMARY OF 300 PM MDT...2100 UTC...INFORMATION ---------------------------------------------- LOCATION...16.7N 113.2W ABOUT 480 MI...770 KM SSW OF THE SOUTHERN TIP OF BAJA CALIFORNIA MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS...105 MPH...165 KM/H PRESENT MOVEMENT...W OR 280 DEGREES AT 13 MPH...20 KM/H MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE...972 MB...28.71 INCHES
WATCHES AND WARNINGS -------------------- There are no coastal watches or warnings in effect.
DISCUSSION AND 48-HOUR OUTLOOK ------------------------------ At 300 PM MDT (2100 UTC), the center of Hurricane Hilary was located near latitude 16.7 North, longitude 113.2 West. Hilary is moving toward the west near 13 mph (20 km/h) and a west or west-northwest motion with some decrease in forecast speed is expected for the next couple of days.
Maximum sustained winds remain near 105 mph (165 km/h) with higher gusts. Some slow weakening is forecast during the next 48 hours.
Hurricane-force winds extend outward up to 25 miles (35 km) from the center and tropical-storm-force winds extend outward up to 105 miles (165 km).
The estimated minimum central pressure is 972 mb (28.71 inches).
HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND ---------------------- None.
NEXT ADVISORY ------------- Next complete advisory at 900 PM MDT.
$$ Forecaster Blake
NNNN
